intro: Microlicia setosa var. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy microlicia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. This variant is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique appearance and adaptability to various growing conditions.
